chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary I Pucely was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow probation to be transferred to Racine County.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail has been applied to Court costs ($278) and DNA surcharge ($250).  Balance of costs/surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Johnson Bank (except for the bank the defendant currently has an account at in Racine).
No contact with James W. (victim listed in the Criminal Complaint).
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours with Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Zachary I Pucely in court with attorney John W. Campion.
Defendant has paid up front restitution.

Defendant pleads No Contest to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dimissed as a read-in.

Court orders the following:
Count 2:
Sentence Withheld

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 years
Concurrent to any other sentence.
Court will allow probation to be transferred to Racine County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Johnson Bank (except for the bank he currently has an account at in Racine) or James W. (victims listed in the criminal complaint)
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  $ 250
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10
Apply Bail
Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
STAYED
To be used at agent's discretion.  
  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
